items.title: Thailand launches airstrikes along disputed border with Cambodia as tensions flare
items.standfirst: Escalation comes after Thai soldier was killed and four others wounded in clashes, more than a month after Donald Trump oversaw ceasefire agreement Thailand has launched airstrikes along its disputed border with Cambodia, the Thai military said on Monday, after both countries accused one another of breaching a ceasefire deal brokered by Donald Trump.Thailand’s military said it was using aircraft to strike military targets in several areas, after a Thai soldier was killed and four others wounded in clashes along the countries’ tense border. A second Thai soldier was later declared to have died. Continue reading...
items.content: Escalation comes after Thai soldier was killed and four others wounded in clashes, more than a month after Donald Trump oversaw ceasefire agreement Thailand has launched airstrikes along its disputed border with Cambodia, the Thai military said on Monday, after both countries accused one another of breaching a ceasefire deal brokered by Donald Trump.Thailand’s military said it was using aircraft to strike military targets in several areas, after a Thai soldier was killed and four others wounded in clashes along the countries’ tense border. A second Thai soldier was later declared to have died. Continue reading...

items.title: Thailand launches air raids on Cambodia as disputed border clashes intensify
items.standfirst: Thailand launched air strikes on Cambodian positions on Monday after Cambodian troops opened fire along a disputed border, killing one Thai soldier, the Thai army said. Both sides traded blame for the clash, which erupted in Thailand’s Ubon Ratchathani province and left four additional Thai soldiers wounded, a spokesman said.
items.content: Thailand launched air strikes on Cambodian positions on Monday after Cambodian troops opened fire along a disputed border, killing one Thai soldier, the Thai army said. Both sides traded blame for the clash, which erupted in Thailand’s Ubon Ratchathani province and left four additional Thai soldiers wounded, a spokesman said.

items.content: The leak in the Egyptian department comes just weeks after a jewellery heist that put the museum's security infrastructure under scrutiny.

items.title: Hundreds of books at the Louvre damaged just weeks after £76m heist
items.standfirst: A water leak at the Louvre has damaged hundreds of books – just weeks after jewels worth £76m were stolen from the famous Paris museum.
items.content: A water leak at the Louvre has damaged hundreds of books – just weeks after jewels worth £76m were stolen from the famous Paris museum.

items.title: Water leak in the Louvre damages hundreds of works, museum says
items.standfirst: Open valve in heating system affects 300 to 400 items just weeks after a brazen jewel theft raised security concernsA water leak in late November damaged several hundred works in the Louvre’s Egyptian department, the Paris museum said on Sunday, weeks after a brazen jewel theft raised concerns over its infrastructure.“Between 300 and 400 works” were affected by the leak discovered on 26 November, the museum’s deputy administrator, Francis Steinbock, said, describing them as “Egyptology journals” and “scientific documentation” used by researchers. Continue reading...
items.content: Open valve in heating system affects 300 to 400 items just weeks after a brazen jewel theft raised security concernsA water leak in late November damaged several hundred works in the Louvre’s Egyptian department, the Paris museum said on Sunday, weeks after a brazen jewel theft raised concerns over its infrastructure.“Between 300 and 400 works” were affected by the leak discovered on 26 November, the museum’s deputy administrator, Francis Steinbock, said, describing them as “Egyptology journals” and “scientific documentation” used by researchers. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: West African Ecowas forces sent to country after group of soldiers announced dissolution of government on state TVWest African troops were deployed to Benin on Sunday after what the country’s president described as an unsuccessful coup attempt.Benin’s president, Patrice Talon, said on Sunday that the situation was “totally under control” after security forces acted to end a coup attempt by a group of soldiers who attacked state institutions. Continue reading...
items.content: West African Ecowas forces sent to country after group of soldiers announced dissolution of government on state TVWest African troops were deployed to Benin on Sunday after what the country’s president described as an unsuccessful coup attempt.Benin’s president, Patrice Talon, said on Sunday that the situation was “totally under control” after security forces acted to end a coup attempt by a group of soldiers who attacked state institutions. Continue reading...

items.title: Benin: the government declares coup attempt has been 'foiled'
items.standfirst: A coup that was announced in Benin on Sunday has been "foiled", the interior minister said in a video on Facebook. Earlier, a group of soldiers had appeared on Benin ’s state TV to announce the dissolution of the government in an apparent coup, the latest of many in West Africa. Details and analysis by FRANCE 24 international affairs editor, Kethevane Gorjestani.
items.content: A coup that was announced in Benin on Sunday has been "foiled", the interior minister said in a video on Facebook. Earlier, a group of soldiers had appeared on Benin ’s state TV to announce the dissolution of the government in an apparent coup, the latest of many in West Africa. Details and analysis by FRANCE 24 international affairs editor, Kethevane Gorjestani.

items.title: Benin: Government says fourteen people arrested over coup attempt
items.standfirst: Fourteen people have been arrested in connection with an attempted coup in Benin, a government spokesperson told Reuters on Sunday. Earlier in the day, a group of soldiers in the West African nation claimed on national television that they had seized power. Analysis by Berverly Ochieng, senior analyst at Control Risk's Global Risk Analysis in Dakar, Senegal.
items.content: Fourteen people have been arrested in connection with an attempted coup in Benin, a government spokesperson told Reuters on Sunday. Earlier in the day, a group of soldiers in the West African nation claimed on national television that they had seized power. Analysis by Berverly Ochieng, senior analyst at Control Risk's Global Risk Analysis in Dakar, Senegal.

items.title: Benin’s gov’t says it thwarted coup attempt after troops declared takeover
items.standfirst: Soldiers in Benin appeared on state television to say they had toppled President Patrice Talon and taken power.
items.content: Soldiers in Benin appeared on state television to say they had toppled President Patrice Talon and taken power.

items.title: Attempted coup d'état in Benin: Foreign minister says situation under control
items.standfirst: Benin's government said on Sunday its armed forces had foiled a coup attempt after a group of soldiers in the West African nation claimed on national television to have seized power. Details by FRANCE 24 international affairs editor, Shirli Sitbon.
items.content: Benin's government said on Sunday its armed forces had foiled a coup attempt after a group of soldiers in the West African nation claimed on national television to have seized power. Details by FRANCE 24 international affairs editor, Shirli Sitbon.

clusters.neutral_headline: Nigeria secures release of 100 kidnapped children, reports say

items.title: Nigeria secures release of 100 kidnapped children, reports say
items.standfirst: At least 153 students and 12 teachers taken from a Catholic school last month remain in captivity.
items.content: At least 153 students and 12 teachers taken from a Catholic school last month remain in captivity.

items.title: Nigeria secures release of 100 kidnapped schoolchildren as 165 remain missing
items.standfirst: Nigerian authorities have secured the release of 100 schoolchildren abducted by gunmen from a Catholic school last month, a UN source and local media said on Sunday. The fate of about 165 remaining students and staff is unclear, with officials providing no updates on ongoing rescue efforts.
items.content: Nigerian authorities have secured the release of 100 schoolchildren abducted by gunmen from a Catholic school last month, a UN source and local media said on Sunday. The fate of about 165 remaining students and staff is unclear, with officials providing no updates on ongoing rescue efforts.

items.title: Nigerian state secures release of 100 out of 265 kidnapped schoolchildren
items.standfirst: Gunmen abducted 315 pupils and staff last month from St Mary’s school in Niger state as part of spate of kidnappingsNigerian authorities have secured the release of 100 kidnapped schoolchildren taken by gunmen from a Catholic school last month, a UN source and local media said on Sunday, though the fate of another 165 students and staff thought to remain in captivity remained unclear.In November 315 students and staff were kidnapped from St Mary’s co-educational boarding school in north-central Niger state, as the country buckled under a wave of mass abductions reminiscent of the infamous 2014 Boko Haram abduction of schoolgirls in Chibok. Continue reading...
items.content: Gunmen abducted 315 pupils and staff last month from St Mary’s school in Niger state as part of spate of kidnappingsNigerian authorities have secured the release of 100 kidnapped schoolchildren taken by gunmen from a Catholic school last month, a UN source and local media said on Sunday, though the fate of another 165 students and staff thought to remain in captivity remained unclear.In November 315 students and staff were kidnapped from St Mary’s co-educational boarding school in north-central Niger state, as the country buckled under a wave of mass abductions reminiscent of the infamous 2014 Boko Haram abduction of schoolgirls in Chibok. Continue reading...

items.title: Nigerian government secures release of 100 abducted schoolchildren - reports
items.standfirst: Nigeria's government has secured the release of 100 schoolchildren who were abducted from a Catholic boarding school last month, according to local media.
items.content: Nigeria's government has secured the release of 100 schoolchildren who were abducted from a Catholic boarding school last month, according to local media.

clusters.title: McLaren's Lando Norris wins first F1 title at season-ending Abu Dhabi Grand Prix
clusters.neutral_headline: Lando Norris wins maiden F1 world championship title at Abu Dhabi GP

items.title: McLaren's Lando Norris wins first F1 title at season-ending Abu Dhabi Grand Prix
items.standfirst: Red Bull driver and defending champion Max Verstappen won the race with Norris placing third, which allowed Norris to finish two points ahead of Verstappen in the season-long standings.
items.content: Red Bull driver and defending champion Max Verstappen won the race with Norris placing third, which allowed Norris to finish two points ahead of Verstappen in the season-long standings.(Image credit: Darko Bandic)

items.title: Lando Norris wins maiden F1 world championship title at Abu Dhabi GP
items.standfirst: Norris finished third behind Max Verstappen in final race to deliver McLaren its first world drivers' crown since 2008.
items.content: Norris finished third behind Max Verstappen in final race to deliver McLaren its first world drivers' crown since 2008.

items.title: McLaren's Lando Norris wins his first Formula 1 world championship
items.standfirst: McLaren driver Lando Norris secured his first Formula 1 championship at the season-ending Abu Dhabi Grand Prix on Sunday. Although Red Bull’s defending champion Max Verstappen won the race, Norris finished third, just behind his McLaren teammate Oscar Piastri, who came in second. This result put Norris two points ahead of Verstappen in the final season standings, clinching the title.
items.content: McLaren driver Lando Norris secured his first Formula 1 championship at the season-ending Abu Dhabi Grand Prix on Sunday. Although Red Bull’s defending champion Max Verstappen won the race, Norris finished third, just behind his McLaren teammate Oscar Piastri, who came in second. This result put Norris two points ahead of Verstappen in the final season standings, clinching the title.

items.title: Lando Norris wins first F1 World Championship
items.standfirst: Lando Norris won his maiden Formula 1 World Drivers' Championship on Sunday after coming third in the deciding showdown in Abu Dhabi.
items.content: Lando Norris won his maiden Formula 1 World Drivers' Championship on Sunday after coming third in the deciding showdown in Abu Dhabi.

items.title: Trump takes spotlight as Kennedy Center Honors recognizes artists
items.standfirst: President hosts awards program, mixing politics with a celebration of stars from music and filmPresident Donald Trump solidified his takeover of Washington’s John F Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts on Sunday by hosting its flagship awards program – a presidential first – mixing politics with a celebration of stars from music and film.This year’s Kennedy Center Honors, widely seen as the top US recognition for lifetime achievement in the performing arts, feted actor Sylvester Stallone, disco singer Gloria Gaynor, country musician George Strait, Phantom of the Opera star Michael Crawford and rock band Kiss. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump says Zelenskyy ‘isn’t ready’ to accept US peace deal
items.standfirst: Ukraine’s president set to meet the leaders of the UK, France and Germany in London on MondaySee all our Ukraine war coverageDonald Trump has said Volodymyr Zelenskyy “isn’t ready” to sign off on a US-authored peace proposal aimed at ending the war between Russia and Ukraine, at the end of three days of talks between Washington and Kyiv in Florida.“I’m a little bit disappointed that President Zelenskyy hasn’t yet read the proposal, that was as of a few hours ago. His people love it, but he hasn’t,” Trump claimed as he spoke with reporters on Sunday night. Continue reading...
items.content: Ukraine’s president set to meet the leaders of the UK, France and Germany in London on MondaySee all our Ukraine war coverageDonald Trump has said Volodymyr Zelenskyy “isn’t ready” to sign off on a US-authored peace proposal aimed at ending the war between Russia and Ukraine, at the end of three days of talks between Washington and Kyiv in Florida.“I’m a little bit disappointed that President Zelenskyy hasn’t yet read the proposal, that was as of a few hours ago. His people love it, but he hasn’t,” Trump claimed as he spoke with reporters on Sunday night. Continue reading...

items.content: US President Donald Trump said on Sunday he was “a little bit disappointed” that Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky had not engaged with a US proposal to end the war with Russia, after days of talks ended without a breakthrough though Kyiv pledged to pursue further negotiations.

Continue reading...

items.title: Americans making tough decisions, relying on credit cards with holiday spending in full swing
items.standfirst: Economists say holiday spending is growing over last year, but at a slower pace. Americans are facing higher prices without seeing more in their paychecks and that's leading to tough decisions at the register. Lisa Rozner has more.
items.content: Economists say holiday spending is growing over last year, but at a slower pace. Americans are facing higher prices without seeing more in their paychecks and that's leading to tough decisions at the register. Lisa Rozner has more.

items.content: "We're reviewing the process, and we'll see," Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said. "Whatever we were to decide to release, we'd have to be very responsible about reviewing that right now."

items.title: Defense Department is reviewing boat strike video for possible release, Hegseth says
items.standfirst: In a speech on Saturday, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth defended the strikes, saying: "President Trump can and will take decisive military action as he sees fit to defend our nation's interests."
items.content: In a speech on Saturday, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth defended the strikes, saying: "President Trump can and will take decisive military action as he sees fit to defend our nation's interests."(Image credit: Caylo Seals)

items.title: Japan is facing a dementia crisis – can technology help?
items.standfirst: Japan is facing a dementia crisis – can technology help? Last year, more than 18,000 older people living with dementia left their homes and wandered off in Japan. Almost 500 were later found dead. Police say such cases have doubled since 2012. Elderly people aged 65 and over now make up nearly 30%…

items.title: Macron threatens tariffs on Chinese goods but seeks trade deal with EU
items.standfirst: French President Emmanuel Macron has threatened tariffs on Chinese goods, just days after a state visit to China, in an interview published Sunday by Les Echos. He also stated that he still believes a negotiated solution is possible to address the trade deficit between the world’s second-largest economy and the European Union (EU).
items.content: French President Emmanuel Macron has threatened tariffs on Chinese goods, just days after a state visit to China, in an interview published Sunday by Les Echos. He also stated that he still believes a negotiated solution is possible to address the trade deficit between the world’s second-largest economy and the European Union (EU).

items.title: 'If there's a coup, then ECOWAS will be willing to step in': West Africa bloc orders troops to Benin
items.standfirst: The ECOWAS West Africa regional bloc on Sunday ordered the deployment of troops from four countries to Benin following an attempted coup. FRANCE 24's Nigeria correspondent Sam Olukoya gives his analysis on the signal that ECOWAS is sending to other countries across a part of Africa increasingly prone to military putsches.
items.content: The ECOWAS West Africa regional bloc on Sunday ordered the deployment of troops from four countries to Benin following an attempted coup. FRANCE 24's Nigeria correspondent Sam Olukoya gives his analysis on the signal that ECOWAS is sending to other countries across a part of Africa increasingly prone to military putsches.
